get.description: GET static api documentation

delete.description: The API server follows a commit model. Unsaved configuration is called a working configuration. This API call deletes the working configuration.

get.description: Get all groups that are affected by the un-committed configuration changes.
get.summary: Get all groups affected by un-committed configuration changes.

post.description: Commit the configuration in configuration database. Services of all the affected groups are started or restarted. If there is an error in the configuration, changes would not be saved into the database. If there is some system error, changes would be saved into the database.

parameters.description: Boolean variable is set to false allow the commit to go asynchronously, default value is true which means commit will go synchronously
parameters.name: sync

post.description: Checks if the un-committed configuration of a device-group is correct. The un-committed changes are merged with the committed configuration and the complete configuration required for the supplied device-group is validated.
post.summary: Check if the un-committed configuration of the given device group is correct

post.description: Checks if the un-committed configuration of a network-group is correct. The un-committed changes are merged with the committed configuration and the complete configuration required for the supplied network-group is validated.
post.summary: Check if the unsaved configuration of the given network group is correct.

get.description: Return list of all the Commit Job ID's
Get information about different types of tables stored for a device of a device-group.
get.summary: Get information about tables for a device of a device-group.

get.description: Get information about columns in a table.

200.description: List of columns in the given table

get.summary: Get information about columns in a table.

get.description: Get information about tags keys and values in a table.

parameters.description: Tag key for which values are requested.
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: Where condition to select values for the requested key. This would not be processed if there is no `tag` query parameter. eg: `tag_key1=val1 AND tag_key2=val2`
parameters.name: where_clause

200.description: List of tags in the given table

get.summary: Get information about tags keys and values in a table.

delete.description: Delete data_store details for the given group-name, or as per the keys passed in query.

get.description: Retrieve data_store details for the given group-name, or as per the keys passed in query.

post.description: Store data-store details in database for the requested group name and key.

put.description: Update data-store details in database for the requested group name and key.

get.description: Retrieve the scheduled state of instances with an active scheduler attached to it and present under the group with name passed in the path parameter.
get.summary: Get scheduled state of playbook instances with schedule.

put.description: Update the scheduled state of instances with active scheduler attached to it and present under the group with name passed in the path parameter.

parameters.description: List of instances and their scheduled state
parameters.name: instances_schedule_state

put.summary: Update scheduled state of playbook instances with schedule.

get.description: Get a list of all the device-group names.

delete.description: Delete a device-group by `device-group-name`. Delete will fail if the device-group's services are running.

get.description: Get configuration details of a device group by the device group name.

post.description: Create/Update a device-group by `device-group-name`. The `device-group-name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the device-group already exists then, old content will be updated with the new content

put.description: Overwrite a device-group by its `device-group-name`. The `device-group-name` specified in the URL and the request body must match.

get.description: Get information about the status of a device-group's services.
Get the fact details of every device under given group

parameters.description: true will first update facts from device and then return facts
parameters.name: update

parameters.description: timeout in seconds to wait for facts from every device
parameters.name: timeout

get.summary: Get a devices facts for given group.

delete.description: Delete all device-groups. Delete fails if services are still running for the device groups.

get.description: Get configuration details of all the device-groups.

post.description: Create/Update multiple device-groups. The new content for the existing device-groups updates the existing content and new device-groups are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing configuration of device-groups. New device-groups are created and the existing device-groups are overwritten with new content. If some existing device-groups are not present in the payload, such device-groups are deleted. This will fail if any of the device-groups that are not present in the payload have running services.

get.description: Get a list of all the device IDs.

delete.description: Delete a device by `device-id`. Delete will fail if the device is being referenced by a device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a device by its `device-id`.

post.description: Create/Update a device by `device-id`. The `device-id` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the device already exists then, old content will be updated with the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a device by device ID. The device ID specified in the URL and the request body must match.

get.description: Get the fact details of a device by its `device-id`.

parameters.description: true will first update facts from device and then return facts
parameters.name: update

parameters.description: timeout in seconds to wait for facts from given device id
parameters.name: timeout

delete.description: Delete all devices. This will fail if any device is referenced in any device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of all devices.

post.description: Create/Update multiple devices. The new content for the existing devices updates the existing content and the new devices are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing configuration of devices. New devices are created and the existing devices are overwritten with new content. If some existing devices are not present in the payload, such devices are deleted. This will fail if any of the devices that are not present in the payload are referenced by a device-group.

get.description: Get the fact details of every device

parameters.description: true will first update facts from device and then return facts
parameters.name: update

parameters.description: timeout in seconds to wait for facts from every device
parameters.name: timeout

get.description: Get the list of events for a device. Filtering is possible with the use of various query parameters.

parameters.description: device-id of the device for which events are requested
parameters.name: device_id

parameters.description: Device group's device-group-name of which the device is part
parameters.name: device_group_name

get.summary: Get all events for a device.

get.description: Get the list of events for a device-group. Filtering is possible with the use of various query parameters.

parameters.description: device_group_name of the device-group for which events are requested
parameters.name: device_group_name

parameters.description: list of devices under a device-group to be fetched
parameters.name: device_id

get.summary: Get all events for a device-group.

get.description: Get instances of a specified device-group event. Filtering is possible with the use of various query parameters.

parameters.description: device_group_name of the device-group for which events are requested
parameters.name: device_group_name

parameters.description: list of devices under a device-group to be fetched
parameters.name: device_id

get.summary: Get instances of a device-group event.

get.description: Get the list of events for a network-group. Filtering is possible with the use of various query parameters.

parameters.description: network_group_name of the network-group for which events are requested
parameters.name: network_group_name

get.summary: Get all events for a network-group.

get.description: Get instances of a specified network-group event. Filtering is possible with the use of various query parameters.

parameters.description: network_group_name of the network-group for which events are requested
parameters.name: network_group_name

get.summary: Get instances of a network-group event.

get.description: Get instances of a specified device event. Filtering is possible with the use of various query parameters.

parameters.description: device-id of the device for which events are requested
parameters.name: device_id

parameters.description: device-group-name of which the device is part
parameters.name: device_group_name

get.summary: Get instances of a device event.

get.description: Get a list of all the helper-file file-names.

delete.description: Delete the specified helper-file. Delete will not fail if the helper-file is being used by some service.

get.description: Download the specified helper-file.

post.description: Upload the specified helper-file.

get.description: Get health-tree of a specified device-group.

parameters.description: Timestamp at which health tree is requested. If not specified, current server timestamp is used.
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Timestamp tolerance in seconds. With this option, health-tree will contain latest data between `timestamp-2*tolerance` and `timestamp`. Default value is `2*frequency` where `frequency` is extracted from `trigger`.
parameters.name: tolerance

parameters.description: list of devices under a device-group to be fetched
parameters.name: device

get.description: Get health-tree of a specified network-group.

parameters.description: Timestamp at which health tree is requested. If not specified, current server timestamp is used.
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Timestamp tolerance in seconds. With this option, health-tree will contain latest data between `timestamp-2*tolerance` and `timestamp`. Default value is `2*frequency` where `frequency` is extracted from `trigger`.
parameters.name: tolerance

get.description: Return health-tree of a specified device identified by `device-id`.

parameters.description: Timestamp at which health tree is requested. If not specified, current server timestamp is used.
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Timestamp tolerance in seconds. With this option, health-tree will contain latest data between `timestamp-2*tolerance` and `timestamp`. Default value is `2*frequency` where `frequency` is extracted from `trigger`.
parameters.name: tolerance

get.description: Returns health of network-groups and devices in device-groups

200.description: Dict of health of devices in device groups and network groups

get.summary: Return a dict with health of devices in device groups and network groups

post.description: Inspect the given iAgent table on a device and return the results.

delete.description: Delete all the previously added license keys.

post.description: Add license keys from file.

get.description: Get the list of all available license id's.

put.description: Update existing license keys with the new one provided in this request.

delete.description: Delete a license matching the license id.

get.description: Download the specified license file based on license id.
Get the license key contents for all the available licenses.
get.summary: Get the contents of all licenses.

get.description: Get the license key contents by the license id.
get.summary: Get the contents of a license.

get.description: Get the status of all the licensed features. Also provides the compliance info per feature
get.summary: Status of all the licensed features.

get.description: Get the logs for all the services for the given {device_group_name}
Get the logs for the service {service_name} for the given {device_group_name}

parameters.description: Number of lines to show from the end of the logs
parameters.name: number_of_lines

get.summary: Get the logs for the given service running for the given device-group.

get.description: Get the logs for the service {service_name} for the given {network_group_name}
get.summary: Logs for the given network group.

get.description: Get the logs for all the services for the given {network_group_name}

parameters.description: Number of lines to show from the end of the logs
parameters.name: number_of_lines

get.summary: Get the logs for the given service running for the given network-group.

get.description: Get a list of all the `network-group-name`s.

delete.description: Delete a network-group by `network-group-name`. Delete will fail if the network-group's services are running.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a network group by its network group name.

post.description: Create/Update a network-group by `network-group-name`. The `network-group-name` parameter specified in URL and the request body must match. If the network-group already exists then, the existing network-group's configuration will be updated with the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a network-group by the `network-group-name`. The `network-group-name` specified in the URL and the request body must match.

get.description: Get information about the status of a network-group's services.

delete.description: Delete all network-groups. Delete will fail if services are still running for the network groups.

get.description: Get configuration of all network-groups.

post.description: Create/Update multiple network-groups. The new content for the existing network-groups updates the existing content and the new network-groups are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing network-group configuration. New network-groups are created and the existing network-groups are overwritten with new content. If some of the existing network-groups are not present in the payload, such network-groups are deleted. This will fail if any of the network-groups that are not present in the payload have running services.

get.description: Get a list of all the `notification-name`s.

delete.description: Delete a notification by `notification-name`. Delete will fail if the notification is referenced by a device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a notification by `notification-name`.

post.description: Create/Update a notification by `notification-name`. The `notification-name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the notification already exists then, the existing notification's configuration will be updated with the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a notification by the `notification-name`. The `notification-name` specified in URL and the request body must match.

delete.description: Delete all notifications. This will fail if any notification is referenced in any device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of all notifications.

post.description: Create/Update multiple notifications. The new content for the existing notifications updates the existing content and the new notifications are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing notifications configuration. New notifications are created and existing notifications are overwritten with new content. If some of the existing notifications are not present in the payload, such notifications are deleted. This will fail if any of the notifications that are not present in the payload are referenced by a device-group.

get.description: Get a list of all the `playbook-name`s.

delete.description: Delete a playbook by `playbook-name`. Delete will fail if the playbook is referenced by a device-group.

post.description: Create/Update a playbook by `playbook-name`. The `playbook-name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the playbook already exists then, the existing playbook's configuration will be updated with the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a playbook by the `playbook-name`. The `playbook-name` specified in the URL and the request body must match.

delete.description: Delete all playbooks. This will fail if any playbook is referenced in any device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration of all playbooks.

post.description: Create/Update multiple playbooks. The new content for the existing playbooks updates the existing content and the new playbooks are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing playbooks configuration. New playbooks are created and existing playbooks are overwritten with new content. If some of the existing playbooks are not present in the payload, such playbooks are deleted. This will fail if any of the playbooks that are not present in the payload are referenced by a device-group.

delete.description: Delete all the retention policies. This will fail if any retention-policy is referenced in any device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration of all the retention-policies.

post.description: Create/Update multiple retention-policies. The new content for the existing retention-policies update the existing content and the new retention-policies are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing retention-policies configuration. New retention-policies are created and existing retention-policies are overwritten with new content. If some existing retention-policies are not present in the payload, such retention-policies are deleted. This will fail if any of the retention-policies that are not present in the payload are referenced by a device-group.

get.description: Get a list of all the `retention-policy-name`s.

delete.description: Delete a retention-policy by `retention-policy-name`. Delete will fail if the retention-policy is referenced by a device-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a retention policy by `retention-policy-name`.

post.description: Create/Update a retention-policy by `retention-policy-name`. The `retention-policy-name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the retention-policy exists then, the existing retention-policy's configuration will be updated by the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a retention-policy by the `retention-policy-name`. The `retention-policy-name` specified in URL and the request body must match.

get.description:
Get a list of all the sensors for the filters provided. Filtering is possible with the use of query parameters.
If you have a sensor `/1/2/3/4/5/6/` and `sensor_name=/1`and `depth=3`, the result would be `/2/3/4`. If you use `append=true`, then the result would be `/1/2/3/4`.

parameters.description: Returns full path of the sensor.
parameters.name: append

parameters.description: Returns list of all the columns for the particular snmp_table
parameters.name: snmp_table

200.description: List of sensors available for the given depth for a sensor_name

get.description: Get the list of `device-group-name`s of device-groups whose services are running.

delete.description: Stop and clean services of a device-group. This will remove all the services for a device-group, however, it  will not clean up the collected data.
delete.summary: Stop and remove a device-group's services.

post.description: Start services of a device group. Use this to start stopped services.

get.description: Get the list of `network-group-name`s of network-groups whose services are running.

delete.description: Stop and clean the services of a network group. This will remove all the services for a network-group, however, it will not clean up the collected data.
delete.summary: Stop and remove a network-group's services.

post.description: Start services of a network group. Use this to start stopped services.

get.description: Retrieve system details for HealthBot system.

delete.description: Delete system-settings. This will delete all the reports, destinations and schedulers. The request will fail of any of the reports is being referenced by a device-group or network-group.

get.description: Retrieve system-settings

post.description: Create/Update system-settings to populate persis-raw-data, schedulers, destinations and reports.

put.description: Overwrite the existing configuration of system-settings. New system-settings are created and existing system-settings are overwritten with new content. If some existing system-settings are not present in the payload, such system-settings are deleted. This will fail if any of the reports in system-settings that are not present in the payload are referenced by a device-group or network-group.

delete.description: Delete all schedulers. This will fail if any scheduler is referenced in any report.

get.description: Get the configuration details of all schedulers.

post.description: Create/Update multiple schdeulers. The new content for the existing schedulers updates the existing content and the new schedulers are created.

put.description: Update operation of resource: schedulers

delete.description: Delete a scheduler by `name`. Delete will fail if the scheduler is being referenced by a report.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a scheduler by its `name`.

post.description: Create/Update a scheduler by `name`. The `name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the scheduler exists then, the existing scheduler's configuration will be updated by the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a scheduler by scheduler name. The scheduler name specified in the URL and the request body must match.

delete.description: Delete all destinations. This will fail if any destination is referenced in any report.

get.description: Get the configuration details of all destinations.

post.description: Create/Update multiple destinations. The new content for the existing destinations updates the existing content and the new destinations are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing configuration of destinations. New destinations are created and the existing destinations are overwritten with new content. If some existing destinations are not present in the payload, such destinations are deleted. This will fail if any of the destinations that are not present in the payload are referenced by a report.

delete.description: Delete a destination by `name`. Delete will fail if the destination is being referenced by a report.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a destination by its `name`.

post.description: Create/Update a destination by `name`. The `name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the destination exists then, the existing destination's configuration will be updated by the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a destination by destination name. The destination name specified in the URL and the request body must match.

delete.description: Delete all reports. This will fail if any report is referenced in any device-group or network-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of all reports.

post.description: Create/Update multiple reports. The new content for the existing reports updates the existing content and the new reports are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing configuration of reports. New reports are created and the existing reports are overwritten with new content. If some existing reports are not present in the payload, such reports are deleted. This will fail if any of the reports that are not present in the payload are referenced by a device-group or network-group.

delete.description: Delete a report by `name`. Delete will fail if the report is being referenced by a device-group or network-group.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a report by its `name`.

post.description: Create/Update a report by `name`. The `name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the report exists then, the existing report's configuration will be updated by the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a report by report name. The report name specified in the URL and the request body must match.

get.description: Get a list of all the `topic-name`s.

delete.description: Delete a topic by `topic-name`. Delete will fail if the topic is referenced by any other playbook.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a topic by the `topic-name`.

post.description: Create/Update a topic by `topic-name`. The `topic-name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the topic already exists then, the existing topic's configuration will be updated with the new content.

put.description: Overwrite a topic by the `topic-name`. The `topic-name` specified in URL and the request body must match.

get.description: Get a list of all the `rule-name`s in a topic.
get.summary: List all rule-names in a topic.

delete.description: Delete a rule by `rule-name`. Delete will fail if the rule is referenced by any other playbook.

get.description: Get the configuration details of a rule by `rule-name`.

post.description: Create/Update a rule by `rule-name`. The `rule-name` specified in URL and the request body must match. If the rule already exists then, the existing rule's configuration will be updated with the new content

put.description: Overwrite a rule by the `rule-name`. The `rule-name` specified in URL and the request body must match.

delete.description: Delete all topics. This will fail if any topic is referenced in any playbook.

get.description: Get the configuration details of all topics.

post.description: Create/Update multiple topics. The new content for the existing topics updates the existing content and the new topics are created.

put.description: Overwrite the existing topics configuration. New topics are created and existing topics are overwritten with new content. If some existing topics are not present in the payload, such topics are deleted. This will fail if any of the topics that are not present in the payload are referenced by a playbook.

rule.description: Name of the rule. This must be of the format <topic-name>/<rule-name>

rule.description: Name of the rule. This must be of the format <topic-name>/<rule-name>

feature-description.description: Brief description of the licensed feature

scheduler.description: List of schedulers associated with the playbook instances

instance-id.description: Unique ID of the variable instance. This should be unique per playbook and rule combination. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

playbook.description: Name of the playbook in which the variable instance needs to be used

rule.description: Name of the rule. This should be of the format <topic-name>/<rule-name>

schedule.description: Name of the schedule that play/pauses the playbook instance automatically

instance-id.description: Unique ID of the variable instance. This should be unique per playbook and rule combination. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

playbook.description: Name of the playbook in which the variable instance needs to be used

rule.description: Name of the rule. This must be of the format <topic-name>/<rule-name>

running-state.description: Current running state of the playbook instance

name.description: Variable name used in the playbook/rule. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

http-post.description: Define HTTP endpoint to post the notification

basic.description: Basic http authetication using username and password

url.description: URL on which http notification needs to be posted

notification-name.description: Name of the notification. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

channel.description: Channel on which notification should be posted

url.description: URL on which slack notification needs to be posted

items.description: Bootstrap Servers are a list of host:port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster

sasl.description: Authetication using username and password over SSL connection

certificate.description: File path to kafka CA-Certificate. Should be of pattern .+\.pem

topic.description: Kafka topic to which Healthbot should publish. Should be of pattern \.*[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+[a-zA-Z0-9\._-]* , Default value is derived from <device/network-group>.<device-id>.<topic>.<rule>.<trigger>

playbook-name.description: Name of the playbook. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

items.description: Rules that form a playbook. Rules must be specified as <topic-name>/<rule-name>
List of supported summarization aggregation functions

name.description: Name of the data-type for which summarization should be changed
Name of raw-data summarization profile

items.description: List of supported summarization aggregation functions

name.description: Sensor field path for which summarization should be changed. Apart from JTI OC sensor path, '<sensor-name>:' should be prepended to the sensor path

items.description: List of supported summarization aggregation functions

name.description: Name of the data-type for which summarization should be changed
Name of raw-data summarization profile

items.description: List of supported summarization aggregation functions

name.description: Sensor field path for which summarization should be changed. Apart from JTI OC sensor path, '<sensor-name>:' should be prepended to the sensor path

duration.description: Schedule duration in days or hours, Should be of pattern [1-9][0-9]*[dh]

replication.description: Number of independent copies if stored in the cluster

retention-policy-name.description: Name of the retention-policy. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

field-name.description: Name of the field. Should be of pattern [a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*
Field name on which count operation needs to be performed

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

dynamic-threshold.description:
Apply dynamic threshold. Learn dynamic threshold value over period
of time and apply it on value

algorithm.description: Algorithm used to learn the dynamic threshold value

field-name.description: Field name on which dynamic threshold needs to be applied

learning-period.description: Learning period to learn the dynamic threshold. Should be of pattern [1-9][0-9]*(seconds|minutes|hours|days|weeks|years)

pattern-periodicity.description: Pattern periodicity. Should be of pattern [1-9][0-9]*(minutes|hours|days|weeks|months)(,[1-9][0-9]*(minutes|hours|days|weeks|months))*

field-name.description: Field name on which max operation needs to be performed

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

field-name.description: Field name on which mean operation needs to be performed

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

microburst.description: Detect microbursts in the egress queues. This has to be used only with qmon sensors

if-name.description: Interface name. This should be field name where interface names are being stored

packets.description: Queue egress packets. This should be field name where queue egress packets are being stored

percentage.description: Queue buffer occupancy percentage. This should be field name where queue buffer occupancy percentage are being stored

queue-no.description: Queue numbers. This should be field name where queue numbers are being stored

field-name.description: Field name on which min operation needs to be performed

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

learning-period.description: Time period on which to detect outliers

sensitivity.description: Sensitivity to outliers: high sensitivity detects more outliers

absolute-percentage.description: Absolute percentage of members that are to be marked as outliers

level.description: Fuzzy level of outliers to be detected

learning-period.description: Time period on which to detect outliers

sensitivity.description: Sensitivity to outliers: high sensitivity detects more outliers

absolute-percentage.description: Absolute percentage of members that are to be marked as outliers

level.description: Fuzzy level of outliers to be detected

sigma-coefficient.description: Number of standard deviations past which outliers are marked

dataset.description: Variable containing the list of XPATHs to the data

predict.description: Learn baseline threshold based on the ML alogrithms and predict value in future

algorithm.description: Algorithm used to create baseline thresholds

field-name.description: Field name on which ML algorithm needs to be applied

learning-period.description: Learning period to learn the baseline threshold. Should be of pattern [1-9][0-9]*(seconds|minutes|hours|days|weeks|years)

pattern-periodicity.description: Pattern periodicity. Should be of pattern [1-9][0-9]*(minutes|hours|days|weeks|months)(,[1-9][0-9]*(minutes|hours|days|weeks|months))*

prediction-offset.description: Time offset in future to predict. Should be of pattern [1-9][0-9]*[smhdwy]

field-name.description: Field name on which standard deviation operation needs to be performed

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

user-defined-function.description: User defined function to populate field value

data-if-missing.description: Assign value for field in case of data missing

value.description: Assign given default value for field in case of data missing

path.description: Reference to a field or trigger in different rule. Format is /topic[topic-name=<topic-name>]/rule[rule-name=<rule-name>]/field[<condition>]/<field-name> for field reference and /topic[topic-name=<topic-name>]/rule[rule-name=<rule-name>]/trigger[trigger-name=<trigger-name>]/key[condition]/trigger_field for trigger reference. Filtering part where field and key are mentioned is optional

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

data-if-missing.description: Assign value for field in case of data missing. Zero-suppression takes priority over data-if-missing

value.description: Assign given default value for field in case of data missing

where.description: List of where clauses to filter ingest data

zero-suppression.description: Assign zero as default value for field in case of zero-suppression

argument-name.description: Name of the argument. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

mandatory.description: Flag to indicate a mandatory attribute

function-name.description: Name of the function. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

path.description: File in which function is defined. This is relative path to the data directory

items.description: List of values which form the unique identifier of the rule

network-rule.description: Flag to denote a network rule

rule-frequency.description: Frequency at which the rule’s field, reference, and vector elements should be computed. Required only when a rule doesn’t have a sensor defined. Specify integer >= 0 followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

rule-name.description: Name of the rule. Should be of pattern [a-z][a-z0-9_-]*

file.description: File where table and views are defined

frequency.description: Frequency at which the iagent should execute the commands and extract the data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

table.description: Table which needs to be used to extract the data

target.description: To run command on FPC, specifiy FPC target (optional)

frequency.description: Sensor subscription duration. Specify integer >= 0 followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s. A frequency of zero should be used only in case of events subscription

port.description: Port on which the native sensors will be received

frequency.description: Sensor subscription duration. Specify integer >= 0 followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s. A frequency of zero should be used only in case of events subscription

sensor-name.description: Name of sensor. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

frequency.description: Frequency at which data needs to be extracted from given SNMP table. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s
Frequency or time interval at which the trigger needs to be evaluated. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

term-name.description: Term name. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

next.description: Continue evaluating next term in a trigger

color.description: Color that needs to be shown in the health tree

message.description: Descriotion that needs to be show in the health tree

all.description: With this flag, result is set to True only if all the data matches the given condition

any.description: With this flag, result is set to True if any one of the data matches the condition

ignore-case.description: Flag to ignore case while matching the string

left-operand.description: Left operand. This is the string in which we have to match the expression.

right-operand.description: Right operand. This is the match expression.

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

trigger-name.description: Trigger name. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

name.description: Variable name used in the playbook. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

type.description: Type of value supported. This information will be used by UI to display options available for the values

and.description: AND(intersection) operation between two vectors. Resultant vector is a set with elements common in both vectors

left-vector.description: Vector name. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

right-vector.description: Vector name. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

or.description: OR(union) operation between two vectors. Resultant vector is a set with elements from both the vectors

left-vector.description: Vector name. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

right-vector.description: Vector name. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

unique.description: Create a vector with unique elements from another vector

vector-name.description: Vector name in which unique elements needs to be computed. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

unless.description: UNLESS(difference) operation between vectors. Resultant vector is a set with elements in left-vector but not in right-vector

left-vector.description: Vector name. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

right-vector.description: Vector name. Pattern for giving vector name is @[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

items.description: List of elements that should form a vector. This can be fields of present rule or references to fields/triggers evaluations in different rule. Format of reference is /topic[topic-name=<topic-name>]/rule[rule-name=<rule-name>]/field[<condition>]/<field-name> for field reference and /topic[topic-name=<topic-name>]/rule[rule-name=<rule-name>]/trigger[trigger-name=<trigger-name>]/key[condition]/trigger_field for trigger reference. Filtering part where field and key are mentioned is optional

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data. Specify positive integer followed by s/m/h/d/w/y representing seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/years. Eg: 2s

vector-name.description: Name of the vector. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

author.description: E-mail address of the rule writer

items.description: List of platforms supported

release-support.description: Specifies the min/max support for this release

vendor-identifier.description: Unique key to idendify the other vendor specifc products

supported-healthbot-version.description: Healthbot version in which is rule is supported

version.description: Rule version, an integer value needs to be incremented for any major change

example.description: This rule collects bgp session route flap damping statistics periodically and notifies in case of anomalies

field.description: This field is for neighbor address

sensor.description: /protocol/bgp open-config sensor to collect telemetry data from network device

trigger.description: Sets health based on bgp neighbor route flap damping.
trigger.synopsis: bgp neighbor route flap damping kpi

variable.description: Enter neighbor name or address using regular expression
variable.name: neighbors

additionalProperties.description: Property value is status of service

persist-raw-data.description: Persist raw data in the database

name.description: Name of the table

db_name.description: Database name in which the measurement is present.

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data

items.description: Sub topics

topic-name.description: Name of the topic. Should be of pattern [a-z][a-z-]*(\.{1}[a-z0-9-]+)*

time-range.description: How much back in time should we look for data

name.description: Keyword part of the keyword-value pair

value.description: Value part of the keyword-value pair

name.description: Name of the macro to be expanded
Name of the scheduler

run-for.description: Duration of time for the schedule to run after the start time

name.description: SSH Key profile name

max-reports.description: Maximux repots to store on disk

name.description: Name of the destination. Should be of pattern [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*

items.description: Report destination

name.description: Name of the panel.
Name of the canvas.
Name of the report

items.description: Attach the report to scheduler

instance_schedule_state_schema.description: Instance associated with active schedule and its corresponding scheduled state

group-type.description: Type of the group. Can be one of device-group or network-group

name.description: Name of the instance

rule.description: Name of the rule associated with the instance

playbook.description: Name of the playbook associated with the instance

state.description: Scheduled state of the instance. Can be one of active or inactive

update-time.description: Time the current status is updated for this instance in elapsed seconds since epoch

instances_schedule_state_schema.description: List of instance associated with active schedule and their corresponding scheduled state
